==Chinese==

===Glyph origin===
{{Han etym}}
{{Han compound|辶|言|c1=s|c2=p|t1=walk|ls=psc}}.

The character was originally a verb meaning “to meet”, whose modern pronunciation is ''yàn''. It was later borrowed for the [[proximal]] [[demonstrative]] “this/here”, by a confusion in medieval handwriting with {{zh-l|遮|this}}.

===Etymology 1===
{{zh-forms|s=这|alt=遮-archaic,者-archaic,只-archaic,拓-archaic,迓-Hakka}}
Derived from {{och-l|者|one which}}, around the [[Tang]] Dynasty.

:{{och-l|者|one which}} > {{ltc-l|者|this (''possessive case'')}} > {{ltc-l|者|this (''general demonstrative'')}} > Mandarin {{lang|zh|這}} (''zhè'').

====Pronunciation====
{{zh-pron
|m=zhè,zhèi
|m_note=zhèi - colloquial contraction of {{m|zh|這[[一]]|tr=zhèyī}}, used when it is followed by classifier or numeral + classifier
|c=ze2,ze3,ze5
|h=pfs=ché/n:liá/yá
|h_note=ché - literary. ''liá'' and ''yá'' may be etymologically unrelated to the Mandarin readings
|md=ciē
|md_note=literary
|mn=chit/che
|mn_note=che - refers to singular item in close distance. ''chit'' and ''che'' may be etymologically unrelated to the Mandarin readings
|w=2tse,4tseq
|ma=y
|cat=pron,adv,part
}}

====Definitions====
{{zh-hanzi}}

# [[this]]; [[these]]
#: {{zh-x|看 這 本 書。|Read '''this''' book.}}
#: {{zh-x|這 是 一 個 老 故事。|'''This''' is an old story.}}
#* {{zh-x|這 不 是 你 的 書，這 是 我 的 書。|This is not your book, it's mine.}}
#* {{zh-x|這 個 就 很 好 ，就 買 這 個 吧。|This is really good. Buy this one.}}
# {{zh-synonym|這樣|[[like]] [[this]]; [[such]]}}
#: {{zh-x|這 可 不行！|'''This''' is not okay!}}
# [[at]] [[this]] [[moment]]; [[right away]]; [[at once]]
#: {{zh-x|我 這 就 去。|I'll go '''now'''.}}
# {{n-g|[[filler]] particle usually used when the speaker is tongue-tied.}}
# {{n-g|meaningless particle in a sentence.}}
